metadata.title: CVE-2014-3564 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in the status_handler function in (1)engine-gpgsm.c and (2) engine-uiserver.c in GPGME before 1.5.1 allow remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly executearbitrary code via vectors related to "different line lengths in a specificorder."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgpgme11 - 1.4.3-0.1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpgme1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3-0.1ubuntu5.1').
